<JD_START>
Job Title: Construction Project Manager

Location: San Francisco, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Job Description

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Project Manager is the Key person fully responsible for the coordination and management of a

project from award to close-out.

The Project Manager models and acts in accordance with DHRG's mission, vision, core values, leadership

competencies, and norms.

The following key accountabilities ensure the critical success of this position:

 60% Coordinate and be accountable for all day-to-day operations and communication to ensure

timely completion of the project and within budget.

 Ensures timely initialization and completion of Contract Routing Process Participate in Post Award with complete understanding of project to delegate any necessary

Functions

 Delegate buyout of subcontractors and materials and hold accountable for deliverables Delegate tasks that correspond to Ops, Project Engineering, Administration and Accounting Initiate Preconstruction meeting Weekly project coordination Project Close Out Post Construction Meeting

 25% Measure and monitor all project costs (Cost Management)

 Manage variance reports Invoice approval Manage Change Orders Billing Production reporting Revenue forecasting

 5% Client Relationships

 Client outreach and communication Relationship building

 5% Personal Development for Advancement.

 Negotiation skills Leadership – take initiative, delegation Accountability Increase personal effectiveness/productivity

 5% Team development

 Development/mentoring of departmental peers

Key success measures (outcomes) for this position:

 Job profitability On- Time completion Customer satisfaction Accurate variance reporting for historical database

Note: This job description acts as a guideline, and the actual job duties may include tasks that are not

outlined above.

Education:

 Degree in Construction Management Degree in Engineering Higher National Diploma/ Higher National Certificate

Professional Qualifications and Experience:

 5 to 7 Years’ experience in Project Management 3 to 5 Years’ experience in the Concrete Construction field Contract Language Review and Analysis

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

 Understand Scheduling software Ability to forecast monthly revenue Ability to develop estimates for change order work Ability to analyze Variance Reports for cost controls

Languages

 Fluent in written and spoken English. Bilingual preferred.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
